definition: soft-spoken/afraid to speak out
mouth/beak/nozzle/spout (of teapot etc)/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]
soft/flexible
variant of 軟|软[ruan3]
lit. the mouth that has been fed by others is soft, the hand that has received doesn't reach (idiom)/fig. one is partial to those from whom presents have been accepted
pinyin: chi1 ren2 jia1 de5 zui3 ruan3 , na2 ren2 jia1 de5 shou3 duan3
containing_words.word: 吃人家的嘴软，拿人家的手短

sentences.english: In some birds, soft areas around the beak occur.
sentences.chinese: 在一些鸟类，嘴软周边地区发生的。

to boast
(coll.) to make fun of (sb)/to play tricks on
lit. to climb all over sb/fig. to take advantage of sb's weakness
to fall out with sb and become hostile
susceptible to force but not persuasion
to save sb's face
inappropriate/bad-mannered
to be anxious/to get angry with sb
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
brazen
shameless/brazen

to throw one's weight around/to put on airs
